intro: Unonopsis rigida, commonly known as the rigid unon, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright, woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it requires specific care to flourish.
